reference.title: result
reference.shortdesc: The <result> element describes the expected outcome for the task as a whole.

section.note: To describe the outcome of specific step, use the <stepresult> element instead.

section.title: Contains
section.p: The content model of this element may differ based on where it is used. Content model information is located here:

section.title: Contained By
section.p: The parents of this element may differ based on where it is used. Content model information is located here:

example.title: Example
example.codeblock: <task id="sqlj"> <titleCreating an SQLJ file</title> <taskbody> <context>Once you have set up SQLJ, you need to create a new SQLJ file. You cannot add #sqlj statements directly in the Source pane of the Workbench.</context> <result>The SQLJ file is successfully created when the SQLJ server displays the "File Created" dialog.</result> </taskbody> </task>
